scenarioDescription:
The HD 1461 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 1461 is a star with 1.02 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.13 times its radius. It is located 76.49 light years away from the solar system.

HD 1461 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 1461 system


HD 1461 b

HD 1461 b was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory observatory, in 2010-01, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.06 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 1461 b is 6.443 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 1461 b is 2.420 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, HD 1461 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.


HD 1461 c

HD 1461 c was discovered by the La Silla Observatory observatory, in 2016-01, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.11 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 1461 c is 5.594 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 1461 c is 2.230 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, HD 1461 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system HD 1461, which contains 2 exoplanets and was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory.
name: HD 1461 - System With 2 Exoplanets
